intro: Eurya multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to regions of Asia, including China, Japan, and the Korean Peninsula. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the spring. Eurya multiflora typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
